page.title: 01 ALYTH, PERTHSHIRE
page.content: This block lies on the North side of the Strathmore Valley and has as its main feature the Old Market Town of Alyth . Alyth has a population in the region of two thousand within the borough boundaries although it is greater when the surrounding Farms are included. Running from west to east through the block is Alyth Burn which is a tributary of the River Isla which in turn flows into the River Tay. Alyth Burn as it flows through the centre of the town bounds the West side of Commercial Street and edges the East side of the Town Square.The burn is fairly rich in fish and the presence of many trout to be seen as the Burn flows alongside the pavement of Commercial Street is very attractive indeed.
